div.l: Toward þe fen þ̉ere wilde marys renne
And forth wᵗith wehe þoᵘro theke ⁊and thorw thēnne
This mellere gooth aȝen / no word he seyde
But doth his note ⁊and with þe clerkis pleyede
Til þᵗat here corn was wel ⁊and fayre groıı̄unde
And whan þe mele is salkyd ⁊and I boıı̄unde
This Iohn goth out ⁊and fynt his hors away
And gan to crye harow ⁊and weyleaway
Oure hors is lorn aleyn for godys bonys
Step on thȳn foot Aleyn come of atonys
Allas oure wardeyn has hese palfrey lorn
This aleyn for gat bothe mele ⁊and corn
Al was out of hese mynde hese hosebondrye
What whedir is he gon he gan to crye
The wyf cam lepȳnge inward wᵗith a ren
Sche seyde alas ȝoure hors goth to þe fen
Wyth wylde marys as faste as sche may go
Vn thank come on hese hand þᵗat bond hym so
And he þᵗat schulde bet̉ere a knyt þe reyne
Allas qᵈuod aleyn for crystis peyne
Ley doıı̄un þyn swerd / ⁊and I wele myn al swa
I is ful wyȝt god woot as is a raa
By goddis herte / he schal nat skape vs baþe
Whi ne haddist þᵘou pit þe capyl in þe lathe
Ille hayl aleyn be god þᵘou is a fonne
These sely clerkis han ful faste I ronne
Toward þe fen bothe aleyn ⁊and ek Iohn
And whān þe mellere saw þᵗat they were gon
He half a buschel of here flour hath take
And bad hese wif gon knede it in a kake
He seyde I trowe þe clerkys were a feryd
Ȝit can a mellere make a clerkys berd
For al here art now lat hēm gon here woye
Lo where he goth þᵗat lat þe childerȳn pleye
They gete hȳm not so lyȝtely / be myn croun
These sely clerkys rennēn vp ⁊and doun
